Is it really reasonable to start monitoring this service when it won't be in production for months? It's simply not possible to be monitoring something, tell the operators "it's not important yet", and then make it important later. People will either be paged when they shouldn't be, or not be paged when they should be.

i don't think we want to start monitoring this stuff right now; it was my understanding that rob just wanted the new software on flying so when we do deploy this (probably midsemester) we can easily update the config files without doing software changes too.

The software is now updated, but I presumably shouldn't close the bug, since it's also for tracking the config change. What in bugzilla is going to fire to notify me that "now is the time to make the config change"? And if the answer is "nothing", what exactly is bugzilla buying us (you)?
